question.title: How to refer to a specific instance of a class in yaml configuration using ConfigurationProperties for POJOs with Lists
question.body:
I am trying to map a yaml configuration file to a complex schema of classes with relationships between the classes in order to build an API that can be highly configurable based on a yaml config file.

I would like to define a yaml file and have spring boot read it into POJO java classes including certain relationships between the classes. For example, the yaml file would define a list of objectA and a list of objectB. objectA would have a property of type List<objectB> and the instances of objectB that are in this list would also be definable in the yaml file.

Is this possible to achieve using ConfigurationProperties?

application.properties:

...
spring.config.import=config.yml
...

config.yml

api:
  objectAs:
    - name: objectA1
      requiredAttributes: # strings
        - attr1
        - attr2
        - attr3
      optionalAttributes: # strings
        - attr4
      objectBs: # ObjectB class
        - objectB1
        - objectB2

  objectBs:
    - name: objectB1 # string
      url: https://google.com #string
    - name: objectB2
      url: url2

ObjectA.java

import lombok.Data;

import java.util.List;

@Data
public class ObjectA {
    private String name;
    private List<String> requiredAttributes;
    private List<String> optionalAttributes;
    private List<ObjectB> objectBs;
}

Model.java

import lombok.Data;

@Data
public class ObjectB {
    private String name;
    private String url;
}

APITemplateProperties.java

@Component
@ConfigurationProperties(prefix = "api")
public class APITemplateProperties {
    
    private List<ObjectB> objectBs;
    private List<ObjectA> objectAs;

}

The application compiles but fails to start the server with the error:


***************************
APPLICATION FAILED TO START
***************************

Description:

Failed to bind properties under 'api.objectAs[0].objectBs[0]' to ...ObjectB:

    Reason: org.springframework.core.convert.ConverterNotFoundException: No converter found capable of converting from type [java.lang.String] to type [...ObjectB]

Action:

Update your application's configuration
